prompt: <description>**CAD Modeling Instructions** **Part 1: Top Prismatic Lid** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0312]. This will serve as the reference for the first part. *Face 1* Create a new 2D sketch on plane defined by the coordinate system. Draw the following lines: * Line 1: Starting at [0.0, 0.0], ending at [0.2917, 0.0] * Line 2: Starting at [0.2917, 0.0], ending at [0.2917, 0.75] * Line 3: Starting at [0.2917, 0.75], ending at [0.0, 0.75] * Line 4: Starting at [0.0, 0.75], ending at [0.0, 0.0] The faces will be formed by connecting the end points of these lines, with loop_1 encapsulating all four lines. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75, and then transform it into a 3D sketch using the given euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the sketch by 0.0083 units in the direction of the normal, and 0 units in the opposite direction. This will create the top lid of the final shape, which has dimensions of 0.75 x 0.75 x 0.0083 (length x width x height). **Part 2: Bottom Prismatic Body** Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 180.0] and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.75, 0.0312]. This will serve as the reference for the second part. *Face 1* Create a new 2D sketch on plane defined by the coordinate system. Draw the following lines: * Line 1: Starting at [0.0, 0.0], ending at [0.2917, 0.0] * Line 2: Starting at [0.2917, 0.0], ending at [0.2917, 0.0833] * Line 3: Starting at [0.2917, 0.0833], ending at [0.0, 0.0833] * Line 4: Starting at [0.0, 0.0833], ending at [0.0, 0.0] *Face 2* Create a new 2D sketch on the same plane as *Face 1*. Draw the following lines: * Line 1: Starting at [0.0, 0.6667], ending at [0.2917, 0.6667] * Line 2: Starting at [0.2917, 0.6667], ending at [0.2917, 0.75] * Line 3: Starting at [0.2917, 0.75], ending at [0.0, 0.75] * Line 4: Starting at [0.0, 0.75], ending at [0.0, 0.6667] The faces will be formed by connecting the end points of these lines, with *loop\\_1* encapsulating all four lines for both faces. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75, and then transform it into a 3D sketch using the given euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the sketch by 0.0312 units in the direction of the normal, and 0 units in the opposite direction. This will create the bottom prismatic body of the final shape which has dimensions of 0.75 x 0.75 x 0.0312 (length x width x height). The final CAD model consists of the top lid and the bottom prismatic body, which have been joined using the "JoinFeatureOperation" boolean operation.</description>
